value.title: Nvidia’s “Chat With RTX” is a ChatGPT-style app that runs on your own GPU
value.excerpt: On Tuesday, Nvidia released Chat With RTX, a free personalized AI chatbot similar to ChatGPT that can run locally on a PC with an Nvidia RTX graphics card. It uses Mistral or Llama open-weights LLMs and can search through local files and answer questions about them.

value.title: ChatGPT's been acting weird — and it's probably our fault
value.excerpt: OpenAI relies on interactions with users to train ChatGPT; their responses could be causing the chatbot to change in unpredictable ways, an AI researcher says.

value.title: Gemini or Bard? Post-ChatGPT, companies grapple with the art of naming AI
value.excerpt: Naming any technology is difficult, but AI is doubly so. It has to evoke a sense of the cutting edge, be at once both sophisticated and safe, perhaps even friendly. A good name leaves room for the technology to grow and change without rendering its moniker obsolete or inaccurate.

value.title: Microsoft, Lenovo, Big Tech Companies Sign UNESCO AI Ethics Recommendation
value.excerpt: The tech giants will be required to safeguard human rights in all stages of AI development, design, acquisition, sale, and usage under the terms of a new agreement signed by the tech corporations GSMA, INNIT, Lenovo Group, LG AI Research, Mastercard, Microsoft, Salesforce, and Telefonica.
